lessons.title: Rule 1
lessons.explanation: There are 29 letters in Arabic language. 28 letters are the consonants. Alif is not consonant it does not have speech sound. When you say ā, it is hamzah not Alif. Hamzah has 3 forms: أ - ؤ - ئ. Long vowels are   ا ,   و , and  ي and they are use for elongation. Short vowels are 3 : fathha, kasrah, dummah. Short Vowels are  بَ    بِ    بُ . Long Vowels بَا     بِى     بُو .
